intro: Ibatia arechavaletae, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant features showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are typically ovate with a smooth texture, and it produces small, fleshy berries that are toxic to humans. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
